name: Parque Campismo de Mogadouro

description: Well-kept municipal campsite, clean sanitary facilities, washing machine. In addition to the municipal sports park with swimming pool, guests can collect free cards at the reception. Very friendly and helpful managers. Baker arrives at camp around 9 am with freshly baked rolls.

title: (5200-200) Mogadouro -

title: (5200) Mogadouro - Unnamed Road

title: (5200) - N216
description: Parking with view of the olive trees is the old road

title: () Remondes - N216

Just after the bridge coming from Pinhero but the same exists on the other side. Very quiet place, nice view. Very little passage on the bridge. Some fishermen in the morning. Place to keep clean. Win waste and toilet paper please. Suitable for small vans (narrow road to turn around)

title: (5200) Mogadouro - N216

title: (5200) Meirinhos -

title: (37254) Mieza - Unnamed Road

title: (5160) - Unnamed Road

Possible to sleep if you can.

title: (5180) - Unnamed Road

title: (37258) Vilvestre - Camoino de la Barca

Magnificent view of the Duero. It must be possible to spend a night there. Warning: It is forbidden to park in the enclosure of the picnic area. Vehicles must be left in the last bend (only a few parking lots).

title: (37258) Vilvestre - 72 Calle Castillo

title: (49220) Fermoselle - 59 Lugar Diseminados

Pleasant, signposted 20min walk from Mirador de las Escaleras for views of the Duero, and also a signposted walk to the river (PR route). Water fountain, but no tap. We were suggested this place for one night by the guide at Casa del Parque.

title: (5180-160) Freixo de Espada - 221 N221

title: () Izeda - 13-14 Largo do Toural

I stayed for one night and it was very quiet and pleasant, I highly recommend.

title: (5225) - 11 Rua da Fraga Mourisca

title: (49240) Argusino - Unnamed Road
description: Nice with access to the lagoon, or what is left of it. Arriving there are several places where you can stop for a night as well. When rain do not come.

title: (37171) El Manzano - 3 Travesía Villarino
description: The area belongs to the North Raïa road (the first cross-border road for motorhomes in Europe) and has 8 parking spaces, a gray water emptying area and a terminal to change black water, in addition, drinking water can be recharged. It also has a CCTV camera and Wi-Fi point. The rest area of El Manzano is located in the same urban area, so it is easy to find out more about this charming town by doing its Urban Route to visit the Church of San Julián Mártir, the Corral del Concejo and its foal, the flour factory or Molino de Sofía La Bondad, the Plaza Propia, the Roman fountain, a traditional house, the Delicias street, the Fuente de las Eras and the block. In addition, you can explore its beautiful places following the network of cycle tourism paths of Bajo Tormes and get closer to the reservoir of La Almendra.

title: (49211) Salce -
description: Level space next to a shady tree. Easy to reach. Follow the Camino de Valjagado from Salce, then follow the signs to the Playa de Salce pine grove.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road

name: Douro Camping

title: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description:
PLEASE READ THE INTRODUCTION BEFORE CLAIMING ABOUT THINGS.

Beautiful and calm place to stay one night. There are public toilets (probably closed), a lot of little uneven shaded places to park, and an astonishing landscape to the Douro river. Near by you can find a fishing spot, a river beach without guard. You can also take a boat trip in "Embarcação Senhora da Veiga" on the other side of the dam just take a look in the website of the city council. I added this place because is in my hometown and I downloaded the photo from google just to show you the view from the chapel. Hope you enjoy it!

title: (5210) Miranda do Douro - N218
description: Next to the main road and roundabout which gives access to the new and old districts of the city. Here, they tend to park the buses with hikers. The place has toilets, in poor condition. Very quiet at night despite the proximity of the road.

title: (5210) Miranda do Douro - 30 Rua do Gidro

Lots of spaces, and room for large motorhomes to overhang. Park in marked spaces - not in several spaces (local police drive past). A good alternative to sloping spaces near the castle walls.

title: (49517) San Martín del Pedroso -
description:
Place in the middle of nature. on a relatively flat and immense terrain. a few meters from the previous spot. the place is quiet and clean. we had the visit of the inhabitants of the village in evening walk (~ 20h). You will find garbage cans in the village as well as a park for children and water.

Thank you for respecting the places as well as the inhabitants.

title: (5300) Rio Frio - Avenida da Fontainha

title: (5300) Quintanilha -
description:
Great barbecue and picnic area around a hermitage. The highway sounds in the background but it doesn't bother. Tables in the shade of hundred-year-old trees. Trash. Fountain. WC.
Today he is clean and at peace. There is not a single toilet paper on the floor. Please, make it clean again. If you urinate or excrete, put the paper and excrement in a bag and throw it in the garbage container
